newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks edge down on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks edge down on profit-taking.

text.p: Jakarta stocks were lower in early trading on Wednesday following profit-taking in both small and big-cap stocks, brokers said.
The Jakarta composite index fell 3.12 points, or 0.46 percent, to 669.74 points at 0335 GMT. Decliners led advancers by 55 to 29 with 47 issues unchanged.
Total turn-over was estimated at 131 billion rupiah.
"The correction had been expected after some rises in the index and the Dow's fall overnight," one broker said.
Losers included big-caps Barito Pacific, Citra Marga and Bank BNI due to profit-taking, brokers said.
Bakrie Land Development, formerly known as Elang Realty, remained among the most active, with some 31 million shares traded.
Bakrie Land fell 75 rupiah to 1,825 rupiah as players took profit following recent rises, brokers said.
Bakrie Land has been among the most actively traded stocks recently after reports that the firm planned to propose a rights issue, brokers said.
The firm was also rumoured to acquire the assets of an affiliated property firm PT Bakrie Kapitalindo, brokers said.
Property firm Modern Land was actively traded, but it fell 50 rupiah to 3,825 rupiah due to profit-taking, brokers said.

Big-cap Indosat fell 50 rupiah to 7,350 rupiah, but volumes were small as only 71,500 shares were traded despite announcement of a rise in the firm's first quarter results, brokers said. -- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
